title.text: hyp: A Toolkit for Representing, Manipulating, and Optimizing Hypergraphs

abstractContent.text: We present hyp, an open-source toolkit for the representation, manipulation, and optimization of weighted directed hypergraphs.

entities.text: representation, manipulation, and optimization of weighted directed hypergraphs

abstractContent.text: hyp provides compose, project, invert functionality, k-best path algorithms, the inside and outside algorithms, and more.
Finite-state machines are modeled as a special case of directed hypergraphs.
hyp consists of a C++ API, as well as a command line tool, and is available for download at github.com/sdl-research/hyp.

introductionContent.text: We present hyp, an open-source toolkit that provides data structures and algorithms to process weighted directed hypergraphs.
Such hypergraphs are important in natural language processing and machine learning, e.g., in parsing (,), machine translation (, as well as in logic ( and weighted logic programming ().

The hyp toolkit enables representing and manipulating weighted directed hypergraphs, providing compose, project, invert functionality, k-best path algorithms, the inside and outside algorithms, and more.
hyp also implements a framework for estimating hypergraph feature weights by optimization on forests derived from training data.
* Markus Dreyer is now at Amazon, Inc., Seattle, WA.
